feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Looking for Global Hierarchy CDS views / APIs keywords/hints please
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

 

I’m trying to locate the CDS views and (Read) APIs for Global Hierarchy in S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition). I have the Manage Global Hierarchies app available in my tenant, but I cannot find corresponding CDS views or API endpoints. I’ve searched View Browser, Custom CDS Views, and SAP API Business Hub without success.

 

Could anyone share concrete keywords, exact CDS view names, API entity sets, or other hints that reliably locate Global Hierarchy objects? Useful context I’m looking for includes:

 

  • Standard CDS names (examples I tried): I_Hierarchy, I_HierarchyNode, I_HierRuntimeRprstnNode, I_HierRuntimeRprstnValue, I_HierarchyAssignedObject, I_GLAccountInGlobalHierarchy, I_GLAccountHierarchyNode, I_CUSTUNIV_HIERARCHY, I_Grant
  • Where to search in the system: View Browser, Custom CDS Views, Manage Global Hierarchies app, API Business Hub
  • What to check if nothing appears (e.g., “Extraction enabled”, Communication Arrangement, Authorization Group, whether the CDS is released/exposed)

 

 

Two specific questions:

 

  1. What exact CDS view names or OData entity sets have you found for Global Hierarchy (any object: G/L, Customer, Vendor, Profit Center, Material)?
  2. Is it common in Public Cloud that the Manage Global Hierarchies app exists but the corresponding CDS views or APIs are not published/exposed? If so, what are the recommended alternatives (app export, BTP custom CDS, RPA, Integration Suite)?

 

 

If you can, please include: the exact view / entity name, where you found it (View Browser path or API Business Hub link), and your S/4 Cloud version or tenant note (so I can correlate whether it’s version/tenant dependent).

 

Thanks in advance — any specific names/examples or short tips are highly appreciated!

 

Best regards,

R_S2

entry.title: XML format mapping with Multi-header on SAP Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Dear Cloud product experts,

My customer has provided a sample XML incoming file with multiple header (multi house bank account).

Is it technically allowed to be imported by "Manage bank statement" Fiori app if a custom XML format mapping is created successfully?
I have referred to the following site.
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/c564dcc579c745e5b08a6d54188e6aad/77561a6a52e44483a8327d68a7ac0ceb.html?locale=en-US

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/creating-an-xml-format-mapping-in-quot-map-format-data-quot-application/ba-p/13552564#comment-on-this

 

Japan local bank statement files are allowed to be imported by SAP localization functionality whether the bank file is multi-header or single-header. I need to know if the global standard functions also is considered such a multi header bank files in the same way.

Thank you for your support & Kindly Regards,
Ai

entry.title: Output Parameters for Handling Unit Label Printing in Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I am trying to print a handling unit (HU) label in SAP Public Cloud via an outbound delivery using the EXTOM channel. However, when processing it in BarTender, I am missing the printer and the label type that should be printed.

I have already used a BAdI to extend the output parameters and successfully added some missing information. However, I would like to have additional details available in the output parameter determination, such as warehouse number, HU type, step, etc., because with these data I could determine which form to send and specify a printer.

Is there a way to include these fields in the generated output file? Any guidance or examples would be greatly appreciated.

Etiqueta de UMp (HU_LABEL) | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: How, in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, to store and map the vendor/sender GLN
entry.content:
Hello support

We need to understand how to include the vendor (sending party) data in the outbound sales APIs, such as CO_EDI_INVOICE_REQUEST_OUT and CO_EDI_DELIVERY_REQUEST_OUT, in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.

  • In the classic DELVRY IDoc, this information was included in segment E1EDRM1 with qualifier OSO.
  • In the classic INVOIC IDoc, it was included in segment E1EDKA1 with qualifier LFL.
  • The GLN (Global Location Number) for the vendor/sender was maintained in table V_EAN_GLN, and the system would collect it from there to populate the respective segment in the IDoc.

We would like to know the recommended way to provide and extract this vendor/sender GLN information for the equivalent Party node in the outbound API payload. Which table or configuration is now used in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, and how can we map this data so that it is displayed correctly in the output, analogous to how it worked previously with IDoc segments and V_EAN_GLN?

Thank you in advance for your guidance.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Non-billable items in service order template
entry.content:
Hello community,

Is it not possible to add non-billable items to a service order template?

We are within the 4X5 Recurring Services (4X5_ES) scope item (Maintenance Plans). In this scenario, the WOs are automatically created from a maintenance plan in which I have indicated:
- A service contract with its item
- A service order template.

When scheduling the maintenance plan, the system generates the Service Orders according to the frequency indicated in the plan. The problem we have is that we cannot indicate the "non-billable" item type in the service order template items. We also cannot modify the item type once the Service Order has been generated.


We need this service order to be non-billable, since my client invoices its clients based on a global amount agreed upon in the contract. That is, the client billing will be created from Contract > BDR > Invoice. Service orders generated from the maintenance plan should be informative for monitoring the work performed for that maintenance, but they should not be billed.


In the CBC, we haven't seen an SSCUI where we can parameterize the non-billable item type for service order templates.

Thank you, best regards.

entry.title: Is it possible to set a different tolerance percentage for each package within a maintenance strateg
entry.content:
Hello,
We are working on maintenance operations on SAP S/4HANA Public cloud Asset Management and need to create a maintenance strategy plan for one equipment with multiple recurring intervals: monthly, quarterly, semi-annually, and annually.
We have noticed that the tolerance parameter in the strategy setup is defined once and is applied to all the packages assigned to the strategy. There does not seem to be an option to assign a specific tolerance for each package.
In our practical scenario, we need a different tolerance percentage according to the interval (for example, 5% for monthly, 10% for annually).
Is there a standard way in SAP to set an individual tolerance for each package within a single strategy? If not, what are the recommended alternatives (custom development, splitting strategies, or other solutions)?

Thank you in advance for any clarification or practical experiences you can share regarding this topic.

entry.title: Are the tax numbers available in SOAP BP API (BusinessPartnerSUITEBulkReplicateRequest_In)?
entry.content:
Hi,

I am looking for the below fields weather they are available in the API (BusinessPartnerSUITEBulkReplicateRequest_In) or not. so far not able to locate it. can someone please confirm if they are available or not?

Applicable API: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/3c916ef10fc240c9afc594b346ffaf77/559b386b43324f0eab0540360dc60432.html?locale=en-US

Field to be located: Tax Type and Tax Number Type

Thanks & regards

entry.title: Mvt type 601 does not check the minimum remaining shelf life, whereas 602 does perform this check.
entry.content:
In the configuration path: ​IMG -> Logistics Execution -> Warehouse Management -> Inventory Management -> Inventory Posting -> Core Inventory -> Set Expiration Date Check, set the "​Check SL expiration date: 1 Entry and Check​" for both movement types ​601​ and ​602​ and save the configuration.

However, when executing a goods issue (Movement Type 601), the system does not check the material's minimum remaining shelf life, allowing materials with a remaining life below the threshold to be issued normally. Conversely, when reversing this specific goods issue (Movement Type 602), the system reports an error: "​Current item (30 days) lacks X days of remaining storage time​", triggers a check for the minimum shelf life, and blocks the reversal operation if the remaining life is insufficient

entry.title: Deletion button disabled / greyed out in CL02 when using a Change Number
entry.content:
Hello Expert, 

  • The delete button on the characteristic tab in Change Class transaction CL02 is disabled / greyed out when using a change number.
  • A change number ( ECM ) has object type 'classification' set but still it is not possible to delete char in CL02.
  • When using transaction CL6K ( RMCLMDEL )  with a change number , a popup is displayed with  'Change number ignored for class type ' CL141 .
    Change number object type 

    transaction CL6K

    Class trying to delete characteristics but greyed out  

    please suggest how to resolve this issue in sap public cloud, i also checked at configuration modify object type but it's not working .
